clinical_study.brief_title: Cognitive Function and Body Mass Index in Children and Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Cognitive Function and Body Mass Index in Children and Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: The child will complete computerized tasks and paper-pencil test, and will be presented with symbols, letters, or numbers on a computer screen and asked to respond by pressing a button on the computer. Before each task a researcher will explain the instructions of the task and assess if the child needs a break before completing the next task. While the child is completing computerized tasks, the parent/guardian will be asked to fill out paper-pencil questionnaires about the child and to sign a release of medical information form so that we can study how physical markers of health effect cognition.

primary_outcome.measure: Perceptual organization index- Matrix reasoning subtest
primary_outcome.description: The examinee views an incomplete matrix or series and selects the response option that completes the matrix or series. Scoring is based on whether the response is right or wrong.

primary_outcome.measure: Perceptual organization index- Block design subtest
primary_outcome.description: The Block Design subtest is designed to measure the ability to analyze and synthesize abstract visual stimuli. While viewing a constructed model or a picture in the Stimulus Book, the examinee uses red- and-white blocks to re-create the design within a specified time limit. Scoring is based on how quickly the participant completes.

The processing speed index measures a child's ability efficiently to scan and understand visual information and complete a task with the data. Scoring is based on how many can the participant finish in 120 seconds.

primary_outcome.measure: Working memory index- Digit span subtest
primary_outcome.description: The task digit span uses numbers. Memory span is a common measure of short-term memory. It is also a component of cognitive ability. Scoring is based on how many correct answers (recall) are achieved

arm_group.description: BMI 5th percentile to less than the 85th percentile

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Local population (based on ethnicity)
- Healthy or overweight/obese
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of developmental delay or disorders
- History of any medical conditions ( that may impact the development)
